text: Mohammad Nasiruddin (20 November 1888 – 21 May 1994) was a Bangladeshi journalist. He received Ekushey Padak in 1977 and Independence Day Award in 1984 from the Government of Bangladesh. ==Career== Nasiruddin published an illustrated literary magazine called Saogat on 2 December 1918. But due to financial constraints its publication was kept suspended in 1922. Its publication was resumed in 1926 and since then it continued uninterruptedly until 1947. In 1926 he organized the Saogat Sahitya Majlis. He had published another illustrated weekly called Begum in 1946. After the India partition in 1947, he migrated to Dhaka, East Bengal, wherefrom the Saogat began to appear again regularly since 1954. In 1985, Nasiruddin served as the first chairman of the trustee board of Nazrul Institute. ==Awards and honors== * Fellow of Bangla Academy Award (1975) * Ekushey Padak (1977) * Independence Day Award Nasiruddin introduced the Nasiruddin Gold Medal after his name in 1976 to be awarded among the writers and journalists. == References == Category:1888 births Category:1994 deaths Category:Bangladeshi journalists Category:Recipients of the Ekushey Padak Category:Recipients of the Independence Day Award Category:Bangladeshi centenarians Category:Honorary Fellows of Bangla Academy Category:People from Chandpur District Category:20th-century journalists
